quest.name: Unlikely Allies
journal: Commander Bloeidin is eager to put you to work.

Commander Bloeidin confirms Urianger's report that the kobolds of U'Ghamaro have grown more aggressive of late. Of more immediate concern, however, is the fact that one of the beastmen may be skulking about the camp, possibly with designs on the crystal store. Perhaps with the aid of Alphinaud and Alisaie, you can sniff out this mysterious infiltrator.

Though Alphinaud readily acknowledges that the kobolds' recent behavior does suggest that a summoning is imminent, he finds it odd that a single kobold would wander so close to a Maelstrom camp and risk drawing attention to the efforts of his brethren. Nevertheless, the beastman's presence presents a valuable opportunity to learn more of the kobolds' plans─providing he can be taken alive, of course.
The curiously small kobold proves quite easy to find, but difficult to catch, darting away after sensing your approach. However, in his panicked, disoriented state, he surely cannot have gone far.

Sure enough, you come upon the young kobold hiding beneath the wooden stairs to the east of the camp. This time, he begins to make a half-hearted appeal for you to keep your distance, but overcome by fear, stops short and flees once more.

You catch up with the kobold yet again, who─yet again─manages only a handful of words before running away. With a sigh, you resume your pursuit, offering a silent prayer that his little legs will grow weary before your own.

Blessedly, the kobold does not attempt to escape a fourth time, having mustered the courage to stand his ground and plead his case. Joined by Alphinaud, Alisaie, and Commander Bloeidin, you listen as he introduces himself as Ga Bu of the 620th Order. The young child then reveals his reason for coming to Camp Overlook: to beseech the Maelstrom to stop the patriarch from summoning Great Father Titan. Ga Bu goes on to explain that his parents, along with other like-minded kobolds, spoke out against the patriarch's plans, only to be taken away to serve as “coke for the furnace.” This ominous turn of phrase prompts Alisaie to recall tales of beastmen fashioning ritual foci from the bones of their brethren as a means to summon more powerful incarnations of their gods. Fearing the worst, Alphinaud instructs the commander to inform Maelstrom Command that Titan's return may be imminent, and declares that the Scions will attempt to infiltrate the kobold stronghold, secure the crystals, and free the prisoners.

Lowering his voice, Alphinaud confesses that although he is confident the primal has yet to be summoned, it may yet be too late to save Ga Bu's parents and the other prisoners. Regardless, you must do all you can to stop the patriarch's plans, and for that you will need to enlist the help of the brave young kobold before you.
objectives: Search for the kobold in Camp Overlook.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: (Is it just my imagination, or is Alisaie staring daggers at me?)

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: <sniff> <sniff> (...I know it was him.)

dialogue.name: BLOEIDIN
dialogue.text: So our friendly neighbors in U'Ghamaro have got much more aggressive of late, just as you said.

dialogue.name: BLOEIDIN
dialogue.text: Matter of fact, our scouts spotted one sniffin' about the stores just now, likely lookin' to make off with an armful of crystals.

dialogue.name: BLOEIDIN
dialogue.text: I'll be damned if I'm about to let that happen! Lend a hand and help us search the camp for the little bugger, would you?

dialogue.name: BLOEIDIN
dialogue.text: Well? What are you waiting for!? We can't go lettin' thievin' bloody kobolds waltz into our camp and take whatever they fancy!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: You've spoken with the commander, then?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Our Maelstrom friends seem notably more agitated than when first we arrived. Do you happen to know why that might be?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: A kobold in the camp, you say...?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: That would appear to corroborate Urianger's information, yes. But to be so reckless as to infiltrate a Maelstrom camp and draw attention to their efforts is passing strange.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Well, there will be time to think on this later. For the present, we must do everything in our power to prevent Titan's summoning─and that means finding and questioning this kobold.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Surely all this commotion cannot have escaped the kobold's notice. If he has any sense, he will attempt to quit this place, will he not?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: One of the scouts said he looked quite small for a kobold. Could he be hiding somewhere like this?

dialogue.name: GABU
dialogue.text: <gasp>

dialogue.name: GABU
dialogue.text: S-Stay back! Away, far, back! I'm n-not a...not a...

dialogue.name: GABU
dialogue.text: Gah, it's no use! Pointless, hopeless, no use!

dialogue.name: GABU
dialogue.text: P-P-Please, d-don't hurt me! I only wish to talk. Yes, yes, just talk...

dialogue.name: GABU
dialogue.text: I...I... Gaaah!

dialogue.name: GABU
dialogue.text: This was a stupid plan! Stupid, stupid, stupid! But...if I tell no one, then everyone will...

dialogue.name: GABU
dialogue.text: Gah, shehe found me again! What to do, what to do, what to do...?

dialogue.name: GABU
dialogue.text: I...I come in peace, only to talk! Speak, say, talk! So please, please, do not hurt me!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: So this is our wily kobold infiltrator, is it? No wonder the soldiers were on edge. He could very well give one a bruised knee.

dialogue.name: BLOEIDIN
dialogue.text: Huzzah, we've got him! Fine work, Scions!

dialogue.name: BLOEIDIN
dialogue.text: So, little one─thought you could sneak into my camp, did you? Plottin' to steal my crystals, were you!?

dialogue.name: GABU
dialogue.text: No, no, no! I came to talk! To ask for help! But when your soldiers saw me, they drew their weapons and shouted, and I...I─

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Now, now, let us all take a deep breath and discuss this like civilized...individuals. What is your name, child?

dialogue.name: GABU
dialogue.text: (-Ga Bu-)Pickman Ga Bu of the 620th Order! At least...I will be a pickman...one day.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Well met, Ga Bu. I am Alphinaud, and this is my sister Alisaie.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Forename, the womanman who found you, is our friend. And now that you know our names, we can be friends too.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Now, Commander Bloeidin here thinks you wanted to take his crystals, Ga Bu, but you said you came to ask for help. Why to us, and not to your own people? What happened, Ga Bu? Can you tell us?

dialogue.name: GABU
dialogue.text: (-Ga Bu-)I...um...er...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: No one is going to hurt you, all right? Not while we're here. I promise.

dialogue.name: GABU
dialogue.text:
(-Ga Bu-)Th-The...
The patriarch, he...he's...
<gulp> ...The patriarch is going to summon the Great Father again, and you have to stop him! Beat him, fight him, stop him!

dialogue.name: GABU
dialogue.text: (-Ga Bu-)Ga Bu's parents said they didn't want it, along with many others! But the patriarch wouldn't listen. He was so angry─raging, fuming, angry!

dialogue.name: GABU
dialogue.text: (-Ga Bu-)He said that if they didn't have iron in their hearts, they would serve as coke for the furnace. And then the guards took my parents and the others away, and I haven't seen any of them since...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: "Coke for the furnace“?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I did not want to believe it...but I have heard tales of foci fashioned from the bones of beastmen, which worshipers use in their rituals, hoping to summon more powerful incarnations of their gods.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: By the Twelve... That is... That is sickening.

dialogue.name: GABU
dialogue.text: (-Ga Bu-)No one listens to Ga Bu, no matter how much he cries─pleads, begs, cries! They do not listen, only talk about punishing the overdwellers and praising the Great Father.

dialogue.name: GABU
dialogue.text: (-Ga Bu-)Ga Bu loves the Great Father, but he loves his parents too! So please, help Ga Bu stop the patriarch and save his parents!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Commander─advise Maelstrom Command that Titan's summoning is imminent. Should the worst come to the worst, we will require their support.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Time being of the essence, we three will attempt to infiltrate the kobold stronghold, secure their crystals, and free the prisoners.

dialogue.name: BLOEIDIN
dialogue.text: Well, if you're sure... You'll forgive me if I don't seem optimistic. We'll make ready, just in case.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Do you know that there are collectors who will pay a fortune for beastmen ritual artifacts? It is perverse.

dialogue.name: GABU
dialogue.text: I tried talking to the others, but they wouldn't listen! So even though I was afraid, I came here!

dialogue.name: BLOEIDIN
dialogue.text: I'll leave it to you lot for now, but at the first sign of trouble, I'm sendin' in the Swallows. Understood?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I have faith that we may yet stop the ritual. We would surely have detected the associated aetheric disturbance had Titan manifested already.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But I cannot speak for the prisoners. Twelve have mercy... That they would even contemplate sacrificing their own flesh and blood─brothers and sisters, mothers and fathers...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Time is of the essence. We must see what else Ga Bu knows and formulate a plan without further delay.

obj.n: The Beast That Mourned at the Heart of the Mountain
